title: Valentine's Day Consumer Data
text: examples analyses using datasets provided. ’ll learn perform basic data exploration create visualizations using package! , use historical_full_spending dataset create combined bar line chart showing total expected average per person spending 2010 2022.  Create separate section dataset, showing different analyses visualizations.
code: ggplot(historical_full_spending, aes(x = Year)) +   geom_bar(aes(y = PerPerson), stat = "identity", fill = "hotpink") +   geom_line(aes(y = total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions * 10), color = "mediumvioletred", size = 1) +     geom_point(aes(y = total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions * 10), color = "mediumvioletred", size = 2) +   geom_text(aes(y = total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions * 10,                  label = paste0("$", total_expected_valentines_day_spending_in_billions, "B")),             vjust = -0.4, color = "black", size = 3.6)+     labs(title = "Valentine's Day Spending Trends",        y = "Spending ($)") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Per Person Spend" = "hotpink")) +  # Specify fill color for bars   scale_color_manual(values = c("Total Spend" = "mediumvioletred")) +    scale_x_continuous(breaks = historical_full_spending$Year) +   theme_classic()+   theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 16),         legend.position = "none")+   annotate("point", x = 2014, y = -12, color = "hotpink", size = 3) +     annotate("text", x = 2015.1, y = -12, label = "Per Person Spend", size = 3, color = "black") +    annotate("point", x = 2017, y = -12, color = "mediumvioletred", size = 3) +    annotate("text", x = 2017.8, y = -12, label = "Total Spend", size = 3, color = "black")

what: Exploring the spending trends on gifts breaking down by age
title: Valentine's Day Consumer Data
text: gifts_age dataset provides insights spending trends different age groups. , create line chart visualize gift preferences among different age groups.  Alternatively, can create interactive charts using plotly package, demonstrated Shiny app. can launch app Valentinetrend::launch_app() explore engaging interactive plots. guide demonstrates use Valentinetrend package analyze Valentine’s Day spending trends. can also explore additional datasets (gifts_gender, historical_gifts_trends_percent_buying) insights. detailed documentation, visit pkgdown site.
code: # Use pivot_longer to reshape the data gifts_age_long <- gifts_age %>%   pivot_longer(cols = Candy:GiftCards,                 names_to = "GiftCategory",                 values_to = "Percentage")  # Create the line plot for gift categories ggplot(gifts_age_long, aes(x = Age, y = Percentage, color = GiftCategory, group = GiftCategory)) +   geom_line(size = 1) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   labs(title = "Spending on Different Gifts By Age Group",        x = "Age Group",         y = "Percentage (%)",        color = "Gift Category") +   theme_minimal()+   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Accent")

title: Valentine's Day Consumer Spending Trends from 2010 to 2022
text: package contains comprehensive data Valentine’s Day spending trends past decade provided NRF surveyed consumers plan celebrate Valentine’s Day annually decade. includes datasets capture total expected spending, average spending per person, spending per type gift, consumer-preferred types gifts broken age gender. package designed help users analyze consumer behavior spending patterns Valentine’s Day especially retailers. Take deeper dive data last 10 years, use interactive charts explore demographic breakdown total spending, average spending, types gifts planned spending per type gift. package provides following datasets. ?gift_age: Shows percentage spending different gift categories, broken age groups. ?gift_gender: Shows percentage spending different gift categories, broken gender. ?historical_full_spending: Provides total expected spending, average spending per person average spending per person different gifts 2010 2022. ?historical_gift_trends_percent_buying: Tracks consumer trends gift-buying, showing percentage people buying specific gift categories years.

title: Valentine's Day Consumer Spending Trends from 2010 to 2022
text: can install development version Valentinetrend GitHub : take deeper dive data last 10 years, use interactive charts explore demographic breakdown total spending, average spending spending per type gift. can explore insights using Valentinetrend::launch_app()launch Shiny app, offers range interactive plots detailed analysis. can see pkgdown site following linkValentinetrend
